column2: OT Star Wars generation if I&#39

column5: s enough variety that you could build your own starfighter variant if you got bored of this one.

column1: Seems to be one of the less common minifigs and its a nice one. He has a cool helmet and printed visor/face plus the usual mini pistol. Would have been nice to have a leg print but the torso print is neat and double sided. He is my son'

,TRUE,4,4,3,4,4 rex501","2015-04-04T18:01:27.54Z","pretty good build but had a small flaw","

When I heard that this set was coming out i was really interested in it and since no pictures were released yet, I had good hopes for the minifigure and the minifigure still fascinates me.

The box is normal sized and has a good picture on the front and the standard picture of the vehicle and minifigure walking and the flick-fire missles. The instructions are normal. nothing really new about them except when you start the build they have you building it from a back view for almost the entire booklet.
The parts are pretty standard except for a new 4x4 piece that has the middle 2x2 cut out of it but other than that the only thing interesting were the little colored studs.
The minifigure is amazing and his hemet print is really cool. his face print is also really interesting and overall i am very satisfied with it
The build was pretty interesting and was fun but found one problem with it. right behind the engine parts is the little gray clip that holds the flick-fire engine wing part. when I
column2: built it it was not going in the clip all the way because the wing part was too thick and so could not clip in all the way and was hard to turn to attack mode so i just switched it with the dark gray stud that sits behind it and fixed the problem.
and is overall not very interesting but it still is worth the buy.

column1: The set is overall worth the buy just for the minifigure and the minifigure looks pretty good in it so I am satisfied with it.

,TRUE,5,4,3,3,5 PooPotato","2015-07-28T20:12:35.793Z","My Favorite MicroFighter!","

When I buy a MicroFighter, it'
column2: s usually for the minifigure&nbsp
column3: so I can compliment one of my ongoing dioramas, such as The Battle of Geonosis or the Battle of Hoth. &nbsp
column5: t pay too much mind to the mini-model, but this set is definitely an exception. &nbsp
column6: I have always been very fond of the ARC-170, the 2005 7259 ARC-170 Fighter was my largest Star Wars set for quite a while, and I would say it is my favorite star fighter from the Prequel Trilogy. &nbsp
column7: So keeping this in mind, it is easy to see why I snatched this off the shelf as soon as I saw it, and for once I was actually looking forward to building and displaying the mini-model. &nbsp
column8: It is shown prominently in the beginning of Star Wars Episode III, and also makes a shorter appearance during the Order 66 sequence. &nbsp

column2: Not a lot to say here :P

column1: The part selection is quite nice for this vehicle, with two printed pieces for the turbine and a nice mix of dark red and white.

column2: Clone Pilot included with this set is one of the few minifigs from the MicroFighter line that I have no use for. &nbsp
column3: I used the Closed Helmet Clone Pilot as the co-pilot for my Gunship in the Geonosis diorama, and I used the Rebel Pilot in a snowspeeder for the Hoth diorama. &nbsp
column4: When Lego released their Episode III line, they didn&#39
column5: t really focus on one aspect or scene of the movie, and released a large variety of vehicles from different parts of the film, so there really was no incentive for me to collect them all. &nbsp
column6: With that being said, the Clone Pilot included with this set is a huge improvement over the ones included with 7259, as V-Wing pilots were used for that set due to technical limitations. &nbsp
column7: The open helmet looks great, with a cool looking orange and yellow stripe down the middle. &nbsp
column8: It is also nice that Lego didn&#39
column9: t reuse the orange goggle printed Zev Senesca face and actually printed a new double sided Clone Trooper face with the goggles. &nbsp
column10: One face looks moderately determined while the other looks angry. &nbsp

column1: The build was fairly standard but fun.
column2: I love how the engines were built, and the customary flick-fires were hidden quite well. &nbsp
column3: The nose of the aircraft was captured perfectly, and the main wingtip blasters look very tough. &nbsp
column4: Unlike the other Microfighters I have, there is a clip next to the rear turret for the Pilot&#39

column2: It is a vehicle that I am very fond of, it comes with a cool minifigure that I really have no use for, and it represents it&#39
column4: I would have loved to see another full-size remake of this set from Lego, but I don&#39
column5: t foresee that happening anytime soon with the new movie coming out this Winter. &nbsp

column1: No real use for the minifig outside of this set
Overall my favorite Microfighter, and hopefully Lego continues with another wave.

,TRUE,5,4,5,5,3 VaderFan2187","2016-10-27T06:53:39.327Z","Missable, though the figure is quite good ","

Microfighters are cute. Some can be not-so-great (AAT), some can be great (Star Destroyer). Which category does this fall under?
Typical Microfighter-style box, small and compact. Not much action can be shown, thanks to the inclusion of only one figure and one mini ship. Just a standard box.
Like all other Microfighters, this build is pretty brief. Nothing particularly exciting here too.
Aside from the minifig helmet and the two PRINTED round tiles, there'
column2: s no really interesting part in this set...

column1: Only play function actually included is two flick missiles under the wings. Whats more fun that that is swooshing the ship around. But... that'
column2: s about it.
s not good enough to be incentive for the set. His helmet looks too bulky to me, and he would benefit from a moulded visor. His face looks kinda weird. The torso is nice, but the legs are plain.&nbsp

column1: Decent value, at 95 parts this is one of the microfighters with better value.
Missable. Unless you love clone pilots or you are a microfighter completist, this set doesn'
column2: t have much.&nbsp
